snippet.title: Safari Rally - (1979) - Arcade - gameplay
snippet.description:
SNK © 1979
[Coin-Op] Arcade Video Game
Emulator: MAME 0.215

Another Head-On type of game, but very playable.  Multiple rows across and a vertical scrolling field instead of a single screen with a track to run around.  This was quite fun, with a few new twists.  The dots on the outside are worth more points then the middle dots, and there are also flags which appear for pickup for a limited time.  There's also a snake and a lion that start marching across your path - and you actually are SUPPOSED to run them over (How's that for fun PETA?)  I did die a few times before I realized you have to avoid the head, or else you are the one who is roadkill.  But the animals give you some nice bonus points.  

Like the head-on games, pressing your button hits the gas for extra speed - a critical element in planning ahead to avoid the cars coming AT you (and obviously loaded with some kind of highly explosive charge - BOOM! when you crash).
